intro: Kohautia stenosiphon, commonly known as the narrow-sheath kohautia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Kohautia stenosiphon is typically found in damp, shaded environments such as forest floors or rock crevices. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
